Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

This change is ready for review.
Do you have anything to back up this statement?  I'm not aware of `+=` being deprecated at a Yocto-level, but I do agree that OVERRIDE tags, like 'mori' are preferred in any meta-layer.
+= isn't depreciate. However, will still use append for uniformity sake.

We should check with Ed if this is the preferred tool to use.  He was trying to get something in place that would stylize all of the Yocto files and I want to make sure the two of you aren't conflicting in direction.
This seems fine.
This seems fine.
This might be fine.
This was already the case.  Can you point to a place where you believe it was incorrect.

An example would be with SRC_URI. In this case, the indent was 24 spaces.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/64575/7/meta-fii/meta-mori/recipes-phosphor/console/obmc-console_%2525.bbappend

However, in the following the indent is 4 spaces.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/64575/7/meta-fii/meta-mori/recipes-mori/mori-sys-utility/mori-boot.bb

Running oe-stylize.py does not affect the indenting in these cases.

Gotcha.  Please realize, there were two tab styles
```
MY_LIST = "foo \
           bar \
           baz "
```
and
```
MY_LIST = " \
    foo \
    bar \
    baz \
"
```
In that example, you've simply changed one to the other.  Both are valid, although I do have a minor preference for the later.


I think I understand now.  Could you please give a little more detail on the above,
Updated commit message to clarify
